intro: Memecylon sorsogonense, commonly known as the Sorsogon Province memecylon, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with smooth or slightly hairy surfaces. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
